results.title: Gravity
results.brief_description: A variety of everyday experiences are used as an introduction to the study of the principles of gravity. Major effects of gravity on our solar system, tides and effect of distance on gravitational pull are demonstrated and explained.

results.brief_description: Contrasts the way in which wheat farmers of the Midwest, USA and the Masai herders of Kenya have utilized similar grassland environments

results.title: Grassland farming
results.creator_credit: Donald Wilder, Julian Biggs and Canada. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Helps the farmer assess his grassland farming practices and suggests ways of increasing gains. Shows why grass is the most economical livestock feed to grow and notes its importance in soil conservation. Shows how to start a good grass forage crop, the fertilizer to use, and the strip grazing method of permanent pasture using a moveable electric fence to allocate a fresh area daily.

results.title: Grasshopper: Anatomy and dissection
results.brief_description: Extreme close-up views and step-by-step dissection show in detail the external and internal anatomy pf the lubber grasshopper. The distinctive, circulatory, excretory, nervous, respiratory and reproductive systems are traced in the insect and on matching anatomical diagrams. Natural habitat scenes relate the structures to their functions.

results.title: Grassed chutes
results.creator_credit: R.G. Downes and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: Explains the grassed chute as a devise for preventing erosion: an eroding vertical gully head can be converted into a gently sloping and well-grassed surface over which water can flow without damage to the soil. Shows types of gullies where the grassed chute control could not be used. Describes with simple animated diagrams all stages of planning and construction of the chutes.

results.title: Grass displaces scabweed in central Otago
results.brief_description: Land ruined by rabbits and overgrazing is restored (after the defeat of the rabbit pest) by sown tufted grass. Main purpose of the film is to show types of grasses which have replaced scab weed.

results.title: Grass and conservation
results.brief_description: Grass is indirectly involved in the production of many essentials commodities - butter, milk, meat, clothes, blankets and soap. Therefore its incorrect use could upset the present and future prosperity of the country. Methods of grass conservation include prevention of overgrazing, extermination of rabbits, and other pests, planting of grass and trees on damaged land and the instruction of young farmers in conservation practices.

results.title: Grass and clover seed production
results.brief_description: Describes how new strains of clover and grasses are evolved at the Welsh Plant Breeding Station by crossing elected strains, careful pollination and then breeding from hybrid progeny. The film then shows recommended practices for farmers in sowing , fertilising, cutting and threshing clover and rye grass for seed production. Grasses dealt with include red and wild white clover, perennial rye grass and cocksfoot. The necessity for use of certified seed in seed production is stressed.
results.description: Describes how new strains of clover and grasses are evolved at the Welsh Plant Breeding Station by crossing elected strains, careful pollination and then breeding from hybrid progeny. Grasses dealt with include red and wild white clover, perennial rye grass and cocksfoot. The necessity for use of certified seed in seed production is stressed.

results.title: Grass
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
Australian scientists are looking at how the use of marijuana affects the mind and body of the user. Researchers and users are shown here examining what happens to a person who is under the influence of marijuana. They investigate the claims that are often made about this drug - that marijuana leads to the use of hard drugs. Marijuana is now illegal in most countries, but the marijuana explosion of the 60s and 70s has led to a growing campaign supporting legislation.

results.title: Graphs correlation regression elasticity (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Deals with a study of the principles by which resources are allocated and production organised. Andrew Pollard examines a number of statistical tools frequently used by economists. These include the graph, regression and multiple regression
